title: Backblaze B2 transfers with an encrypted destination do not complete
body:
Linked from #533 

I have a B2 remote called "remote" and a secret remote going to this called "secret". I'm using the command line:

rclone -I -v sync etc secret:flibble/etc2 2>&1

The -I is there because I was getting errors where it wouldn't transfer because the modification times are the same, which is strange because the directory is empty on B2. This might be an indicator.

This is using the rclone beta provided by @ncw version v1.33-6-g2eaac80β running on Ubuntu 16.04 amd64.

The output is, with a few lines removed:

> 2016/09/06 09:49:04 rclone: Version "v1.33-6-g2eaac80β" starting with parameters ["./home/marc/git/rclone-v1.33-6-g2eaac80β-linux-amd64/rclone" "-I" "-v" "sync" "etc" "secret:flibble/etc2"]
> 2016/09/06 09:49:04 Encrypted Local file system at /remote/berbg28gsc22d0pktgipsqshkg/n9nn9n1mk24irmrt29gu5ce7ek: Modify window is 1ns
> 2016/09/06 09:49:04 resolv.conf: Can't transfer non file/directory
> 2016/09/06 09:49:05 legal: Uploading unconditionally as --ignore-times is in use
> 2016/09/06 09:49:05 login.defs: Uploading unconditionally as --ignore-times is in use
> 2016/09/06 09:49:05 mtab: Can't transfer non file/directory
> 2016/09/06 09:49:05 upstart-xsessions: Uploading unconditionally as --ignore-times is in use
> 2016/09/06 09:49:05 vdpau_wrapper.cfg: Uploading unconditionally as --ignore-times is in use
> ....many, many other files uploading unconditionally
> 2016/09/06 09:49:30 fonts/conf.avail/58-dejavu-lgc-sans-mono.conf: Copied (replaced existing)
> 2016/09/06 09:49:30 fonts/conf.avail/57-dejavu-sans-mono.conf: Copied (replaced existing)
> 2016/09/06 09:49:30 ssl/certs/java/cacerts: Copied (replaced existing)
> 2016/09/06 09:49:30 Waiting for deletions to finish
> 2016/09/06 09:49:30 
> Transferred:   8.023 MBytes (322.229 kBytes/s)
> Errors:                 0
> Checks:              1869
> Transferred:         1869
> Elapsed time:       25.4s
> 2016/09/06 09:49:30 Go routines at exit 2

This actually completes near instantly, but you see different timestamps because I used less. Nothing is actually transferred to B2 from what I can tell.
